items.text: It's Okay to Be White is a movement started on [[LINK|lang_en|4chan|4chan]] wherein people posted stickers and posters that read the [[LINK|lang_en|Eponym|Eponym]]"It's Okay to Be White" around metropolitan areas. [[CITE|5|http://popnewsmagazine.com/4chan-launches-its-ok-to-be-white-campaign-causing-mass-outrage-worldwide]]

The [[LINK|lang_en|anonymous|Anonymous]] [[LINK|lang_en|Imageboard|Imageboard]] known as 4chan hosted a post in late October where someone outlined a guideline on how to achieve the greatest reach. It contained instructions on where to order stickers and warned participants to avoid violent confrontations with [[LINK|lang_en|Antifa|Antifa]] on November 4th. People were instructed to remain silent in the event of police questioning. [[CITE|5|http://popnewsmagazine.com/4chan-launches-its-ok-to-be-white-campaign-causing-mass-outrage-worldwide]]

A subsequent post instructed the participants of the movement to take down all posters that contained links to far-right websites, claiming them to be [[LINK|lang_en|Counterintelligence|Counterintelligence propaganda]] to create further divide and stifle the movement's reputation. They stressed "uniformity" and to avoid adding any [[LINK|lang_en|Url|URL]] s to the posts. [[CITE|7|https://everipedia-storage.s3.amazonaws.com/NewlinkFiles/17039585/b3810___its-okay-to-be-white/post-about-the-protest.jfif]]
The message is purportedly against [[LINK|lang_en|White_guilt|White guilt]] and the demonization of white culture.

It's Okay to Be White has faced criticism for promoting minor [[LINK|lang_en|Vandalism|Vandalism]] such as posting stickers on others'[[LINK|lang_en|property|Property]]. [[CITE|5|http://popnewsmagazine.com/4chan-launches-its-ok-to-be-white-campaign-causing-mass-outrage-worldwide]]

Some have declared the statement to be a form of [[LINK|lang_en|Hate_speech|Hate speech]]. [[CITE|5|http://popnewsmagazine.com/4chan-launches-its-ok-to-be-white-campaign-causing-mass-outrage-worldwide]]People have shared videos on [[LINK|lang_en|twitter|Twitter]] tearing down the signs. Ironically, this has been celebrated by the It's Okay to Be White activists for proving their claim that there is intolerance for whiteness.
